test-case.name: fn-lower-case1args-1
test-case.description: Evaluates The "lower-case" function with the arguments set as follows: $arg = xs:string(lower bound)

test-case.name: fn-lower-case1args-2
test-case.description: Evaluates The "lower-case" function with the arguments set as follows: $arg = xs:string(mid range)

test-case.name: fn-lower-case1args-3
test-case.description: Evaluates The "lower-case" function with the arguments set as follows: $arg = xs:string(upper bound)

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-1
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function as per example 1 (for this function) from the F&O specs.

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-2
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function using the empty sequence Uses the count function to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-3
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function that uses only numbers as part of argument Use of count function to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-4
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function that uses both numbers and letters as part of argument

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-5
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function that uses only upper case letters as part of argument

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-6
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function that uses only lower case letters as part of argument

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-7
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function that uses both upper and lower case letters as part of argument

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-8
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function that uses the empty string as part of argument Uses "fn:count" to avoid the empty file

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-9
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function that uses the "upper-case" as part of argument

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-10
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function with argument set to "*****"

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-11
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function with argument set to another lower-case function

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-12
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function as an argument to the "fn:boolean" function

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-13
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function as an argument to the "fn:concat" function

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-14
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function as an argument to the "fn:not" function

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-15
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function with argument set to "%$#@!"

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-16
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function with argument set to "lower-case"

test-case.name: fn-lower-case-17
test-case.description: Evaluation of lower-case function as part of a boolean expression

test-case.name: K-LowerCaseFunc-1
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `lower-case()`.

test-case.name: K-LowerCaseFunc-2
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `lower-case("string", "wrong param")`.

test-case.name: K-LowerCaseFunc-3
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `lower-case(()) eq ""`.

test-case.name: K-LowerCaseFunc-4
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `upper-case("abCd0") eq "ABCD0"`.
